Module org.nasdanika.resources
Package org.nasdanika.resources

Class MapContainer<E>

java.lang.Object
org.nasdanika.resources.MapContainer<E>
Type Parameters:
T -
All Implemented Interfaces:
Container<E>, Resource<E>
Direct Known Subclasses:
EphemeralBinaryEntityContainer, EphemeralEntityContainer
public class MapContainer<E> extends Object implements Container<E>
Container backed by a map. For this container delete() means removal from the map.
Author:
Pavel

    • getContainer

      public Container<E> getContainer(String path, ProgressMonitor monitor)
      Description copied from interface: Container
      Returns a container for a given path. It is a logical operation - the container doesn't have to exist.
      Specified by:
      getContainer in interface Container<E>
      Returns:
      Container instance or null if it would not be possible to create such a container, e.g. an element with this path already exists or one of path elements is not a container.

    • copy

      public void copy(Container<? super E> container, String path, ProgressMonitor monitor)
      Description copied from interface: Resource
      Copies the resource to the target container under a given path.
      Specified by:
      copy in interface Resource<E>
      Parameters:
      container - Target container, may be the same container.
      path - Path to copy the resource to.
      monitor - Parent progress monitor, the resource splits the monitor and takes size() ticks.

    • move

      public void move(Container<? super E> container, String path, ProgressMonitor monitor)
      Description copied from interface: Resource
      Moves the resource to the target container under a given path. Equivalent to copying and then deleting.
      Specified by:
      move in interface Resource<E>
      Parameters:
      container - Target container.
      path - Path to move the resource to.
      monitor - Parent progress monitor, the resource splits the monitor and takes 2*size() ticks - one size for reading and one for writing.
